message: Any local LA people willing to hack on Packaginator this Saturday? Either at Cartwheel HQ or in Camarillo?
Me!
So far we have @pydanny, @ptone, @jacobburch, @askbot7, @audreyr sprinting at our office all day this Sat, and possibly a few others.
If you guys want to do a sprint in April or May, I'll probably be out in LA then.
If you come into town we'll certainly host a sprint! The first 10 days or so of May my mom is in Los Angeles but otherwise we are open. Let us know!
@natea Sweet! Yeah, let us know.
Not sure how you guys feel about remote sprinting, but I'd love to code some more! If there's anything I can help with, please let me know : )
We'll need lots of help. Get on convore and ask for things to do!
I'd help sprint, but I'm all the way out in Miami
@grobolom Hey! You around?
Hey @nyxtom, you can join us remotely!
@paparent Just convore :)
@audreyr ok :) Let see how I could help in some way. will start installing it and see what i could do!
Hi all :) I never participate to a sprint and Packaginator project is really nice! Are you using only Convore, or an IRC channel too ?
If you run into installation issues, let me know and I'll help you and update the docs.
@paparent Cool! The install docs at http://packaginator.readthedocs.org/ are up-to-date and regularly updated
Once you're all set up, I'll point you to an easier starter issue to get your feet wet with the code
@audreyr Cool, installatin done. Had to manually do "sudo apt-get install libpq-dev" and "pip install psycopg2" on ubuntu because it raised an exception complaining on psycopg2.
@audreyr I can start with 1), and then look at 2) I guess :)
@paparent Want to 1) add those to the install docs, commit, and submit a pull request?
@paparent sounds good!
@paparent Ok great
@paparent 2) work on https://github.com/cartwheelweb/packaginator/issues#issue/62 ?
